Pre-reqs: (High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 95% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12; or (b) permission from the Mathematics Department Head.)
This is an Honours course. Prerequisite: High school calculus and at least 95% in PREC 12 or PREC 12 with a letter of invitation from the Math Department based on performance in the COMC Exam; or permission from the Undergraduate Chair. If you satisfy the prerequisite but are unable to register yourself into the course, please email the Undergraduate Chair, at ugradchair@math.ubc.ca, to register, quoting your UBC student number.
description: Limits, derivatives, Mean Value Theorem and applications, elementary functions, optimization, Taylor series, approximation. Please consult the Faculty of Science Credit Exclusion List: www.students.ubc.ca/calendar/index.cfm?tree=12,215,410,414.
